djangotailoring.models¶

Djangotailoring provides a set of model classes that can be used for subject data storage, one of which is abstract.

Models¶

class djangotailoring.models.SubjectData¶

An abstract model class that is useful for storing subject data as columns in a wide table. Subclasses can be used in concert with djangotailoring.subjects.DjangoSubjectLoader to make fetching and updating subjects in such a fashion straightforward.

user_id¶

A 40-character text field that is unique per table this is what’s used to identify the subject; it can be anything. It is conventionally the same as the user id of the auth.User objects, if used.

modified¶

A timestamp indicating the last time that the table was modified by any Django-level .save() command

as_json(self)¶
Return type:a string
Returns:the JSON representation of as_dict().
as_dict(self)¶
Return type:a dictionary
Returns:a dictionary of instance attribute names to their values.
class djangotailoring.models.SerializedSubjectData¶

A concrete model class that is used for subject storage. All data is stored as a text blob, and it is up to clients to encode and decode the primary_data for each instance. It is used by djangotailoring.subjects.SerializedSubjectLoader as its storage mechanism.

user_id¶

A 40-character text field that is unique per table this is what’s used to identify the subject; it can be anything. It is conventionally the same as the user id of the auth.User objects, if used.

primary_data¶

A sizeless text blob used to store subject data.

updated¶

A timestamp indicating the last time that the primary_data was changed by any Django-level .save() command
